channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipped waste on Oakwood Avenue, 21st July
item.description:
Appeared today 21 July. I didn’t notice anyone leave it there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakwood Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All traffic lights out on this roundabout, 21st July
item.description:
All the traffic lights are out on on this roundabout, already a dangerous roundabout but made it even more hellish today with no lights. Passed by at around 6 and 8 and were out both times.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped paint cans outside no. 52 Thicket road, 21st July
item.description:
The cans are large and have been there for at least 2 weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thicket Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised tarmac in kerb stopping rainwater and debris flow to nearby drain, 21st July
item.description:
This has been an outstanding issue for some considerable time resulting in the need for residents to physically sweep water past the raised tarmac caused by tree root damage. It has been reported on more than one occasion with no action. It is clearly worsening and yet is an easy issue to remedy ...please action
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravenscroft Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 21st July
item.description:
Absolutely disgusting fly tipping that happens by our bins almost weekly. It is so unsafe, there need to be cameras put outside so the people doing this can be caught

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Waldram Park Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of clutter and decay, 21st July
item.description:
It’s been weeks now - the scaffolding near the Jago’s become a dumping ground. Old furniture and general filth left to rot.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glebe Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Graffiti on OKR opp Asylum Road, 21st July
item.description:
I saw these two yobs in the act of spraying graffiti. They didnt like being photographed and shouted insults at me. Get em and punish them. Make them spend 200 hours taking down grafiti

item.title: Foul sleep and A LOT of litter, 21st July
item.description:
The entrance to the ridgeway is extremely filthy. So much litter all over the path and in an the bushes. The ridgeway is not very well kept lately and build of homeless people there makes it feel an uncomfortable place to run/walk
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): White Hart Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lemmon Road houses front pavement needs weeding., 21st July
item.description:
Year after year its the same, no weeding or sweeping done, the weeds are nearly knee high in places. When an attempt happens it's a botch job leaving most of the weeds and a mess.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lemmon Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Caravan on public space, 21st July
item.description:
There is a caravan parked on the public grass area outside 165 bracondale Road. It does not have registration plates but hasn't been dumped/abandoned as it has a private wheel security measure/clamp to prevent theft, it also has a tow bar. It is an eye sore and prevents public use of the grass area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bracondale Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole street front and back needs sweeping and weeded., 21st July
item.description:
The street is slowly being covered with litter and debris from the trees along the railway line. Brambles are encroaching on the road surface. Weeds are spreading across the pavement at the front of the houses and will soon be knee deep.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lemmon Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
